alert.note: Alert for Nowata; Osage; Pawnee; Washington (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 09 at 6:12PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Osage, northern Washington, northern Nowata and northwestern Pawnee Counties through 700 PM CDT... At 609 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated an outflow of strong winds along a line extending from near Peru to 4 miles north of Pearsonia to 5 miles west of Newkirk. Movement was southeast at 35 mph. The outflow winds were ahead of a line of thunderstorms which will continue to move south into northeast Oklahoma through 7 pm. Additional strong gusts may accompany the storms. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations in or near the path include... Bartlesville... Pawhuska... Dewey... Fairfax... South Coffeyville... Copan... Shidler... Wynona... Ralston... Burbank... Wann... Elgin... Grainola... Foraker... Bigheart... Bartlesville Municipal Airport... Osage Hills State Park... Pearsonia... Hulah... Sunset Lake... MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
